Great when it works. Having offline access to some of the information you can download on here is useful for a multitude of situations. But many files are straight up incompatible with the app, near constant crashes when opening or switching between downloaded files, some don't open at all, and it could use filters to better search for files worth downloading. Ultimately a great idea, but it doesn't run well on my device at least (Google Pixel 6a). Would love to see some stability improvements.
i now have the entire Wikipedia on my phone

Doesn't seem to work with USB sticks anymore I have a dump of Wikipedia on a USB Stick I used to be able to use it with Kiwix but after recent updates they must have taken out that functionality I can view the zim file on the file explorer but not via Kiwix

google_play_reviews.content: It's really a wonderful app to search in.It gives you more that one information that you need.Also,it has reliable informations from dependable. Truly,it is a helpful app.
Trying to download any files larger than 500mb is painfull. The app keeps pausing the download. Have to shut down app and restart every 10 mins. Please help.
Does not work. After downloading the zim file it won't open
This is very amazing and informative offline version of Wikipedia so I like it very much.
Does exactly what I ask of it, in a clear and concise fashion!

Sucks, doesn't support OTG. They try to say most phones don't support OTG. But that is not the case at all. Most phones, besides some entry level phones, support OTG. My S22 Ultra supports OTG but Kiwix does not. So basically is useless to me. And it hasn't been updated since Oct 10, 2021. I think they stopped supporting it. Kiwix, get with times! In reference to Kiwix reply: If I plug a USB C flash drive into my phone I can access it throuh the samsung file system. Also with office, adobe, etc
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Android does not provide a native access to filesystem via OTG. This is the reason why we can't. Nobody really can.

google_play_reviews.content: Normally a fan but its not working on my new phone. Worked fine on my s9 but it will not find my ZIM files on my S10 even though they're stored in the same place as the last phone. Wish there was a way I could manually tell it which file to pull from. Edit: I tried taking the sim card from my s9 and putting it in my s10 and still nothing. It makes no sense how this app works fine on my old phone and can't work on the next one despite running the same version of the app. Very bummed.
After last update this app My downloaded file (zim) not load in this app why?

After obtaining a new phone, I'm starting to suspect that the issues I previously had with this app we're related to either the phone I was using or the version of Android I was using. This one seems much better. It is stable, the download manager appears to function well and a stable, and the only criticism that I can think of is the fact that it sometimes takes quite a while to load a very large file like Wikipedia which is currently over 90GB.

Hi, please this app used to work well until after the last update, it stopped working. I have Kiwix database downloaded in my library, But the app says there is no book in the library. It couldn't detect it anymore. Please can you fix this. Thank you very much.

This is great! I love it. I use it all the time.. - [Edit 27/6 - 2023] App has suddenly stopped working on my Samsung Galaxy Z: It can't find the .zim files.. I've tried replacing the .zim files, and I've tried reinstalling the app, but nothing helps. :'( It was good when it worked. PS It still works on my old Motorola G7 Play which is permanently offline.

This is very good or excellent as it can search and return results and content while offline for the Wikipedia Simple English Long Version Text Without Images. For the Stack Exchange Life Hacks, it is searchable by keywords only, but when I first installed it, I could search with a phrase of words. To be even more impressive, this Kiwix app should have WikiHow available and operating offline!
Worst ever, I just end up using another app that offline. This app just don't download the offline notes. It takes forever. More than 5hrs have pass already for approx 1GB book. That's ridiculous.
Useless now. It does not read zim file on your external SD any more, so if don't have lots of internal memory it is useless.
Great app. It works well but with the latest update I wasn't able to open a file that was saved in my phone. But anyways I downloaded it again from Kiwix and it works.

I loved the old Kiwix. I got a new phoone that no longer has an microSD card and I cannot direct Kiwix to the zim file. It doesn't see the file. This new version is terrible. I will be looking to see if an older version works properly.
Impressive. All Wikipedia is available for download
It's very helpful, but there's a big problem, which is i can't update the Wikipedia file. The only choice is to download the latest files again while i have the old one, but i need only update.
Great app. UX could use a bit of polish, but works well overall
The fact that it works offline is a big step to solving internet access issues in remote areas.

Great if you want information about various topics for offline use! Negative points include: A lot of content is not up to date. No preview and selection for downloading. Links are not connected to downloaded content, you need to have internet access to see the page or find it somehow in the downloaded content. However, you get to explore some content you would never have stumbled upon otherwise. And you also get entertainment and valuable information offline.
Apperciate your effort to expand knowledge.
It is one of the best applications that I have used in my life.

Very good app, especially for people without good internet speeds
great app , special thanks to developers
Great job guys, I have no words to say thank you for your amazing works

Love having offline repos of knowledge. I'm outside of cell reception alot so it's great to have this option. I did not use the download manager so I can't speak to the negativity there (I prefer bit torrent for public files) but the app found the downloaded torrent pretty quickly, nice. (Update) Not sure if my device updated and caused trouble or what, but I did have to switch to their official version from their website to keep compatibility with with my external SD card.

Downloading is absolutely terrible. Gave up after spending a while just trying to download a wiki and getting nothing. Download doesn't start, doesn't even show up in my downloada list, I have to search for the item again and I see there it's "pending" whatever that means. Doesn't download on mobile data or WiFi, and my home Internet connection is gigabit so my Internet definitely isn't at fault. Dead app hasn't been updated for over 2 years, the servers to download from are probably dead too.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: I would recommend to join the beta test program to update to 3.7.1. Considering that support of Android 13 has been introduced, that should fix the problem.

google_play_reviews.content: Great idea and the reader is good but download management is abyssml. I can get any large files to ever finish downloading.

No ability to load files that were not downloaded in the app. This is extremely limiting. I have already downloaded Wikipedia on my PC which is ~100GB, why do I need to download it on every device from the internet? MISSING VERY BASIC FUNCTION. It also does not have compatibility with old data - older versions of Wikipedia will not load. Not everyone needs the latest files, but sometimes you need the latest reader to work with your OS. Wiki needs a new reader with a new dev team.
Solid and exactly what I needed.
Lovely app filled with a multitude of educational information
Works great, if I were to ask for anything though, I would like the method for updating libraries to be simpler.

Genius. I'm an often homeless translady who lives in the backcountry without internet access. Kiwix offline is the most amazing resource and has literally helped me to survive. If you believe in preparedness you must have this app. Thank you Kiwix. I wish I had more than just a review to give. You must surely be aware of the impact your app has on afflicted peoples. But please acept my personal anecdote as meager tribute to your awesome work. From the bottom of my heart: Thank you Kiwix!

Your current version doesn't allow the contents to be downloaded directly to SD card in chunks of 2 GB or 3.99 GB. The SD card can't store a single file exceeding 4GB, so this app is now 100% compatible with PCs but not with Android devices.

I decided I wanted a way to read informative text offline. When I looked into "downloading wikipedia" this was one of the primary candidates. I like the repository of texts. Im looking forward to reading.

Overall a pretty good app. But I have several files in the proper format that I can't open, because the app refuses to detect them, and THERE'S NO FILE OPEN COMMAND. This is arrogant and stupid, like you want your application to be a closed ecosystem. Add a file open command, and I'll change my review to 5 stars.

An informative app which is necessary for everybody. Thanks a lot dear developers. It's unique, I haven't seen anything like this before! And enjoying it a lot. Would you please add synonyms and antonyms to persian wiktionary.

great app, but ive been trying to download the full english wikipedia and so far, ive downloaded 79.24gb of data out of 79.3gb according to my device. however, the progress meter is only at half. why is this the case?
This is a book reader NOT Wikipedia offline

Not bad, but it has some little quality of life annoyances: * No real dark mode, just inverted colours (yellow links...) * You have to click on every heading to unfold it * When you accidentally press on bookmark and then want to unbookmark it by pressing again... it just adds yet another bookmark
Nice app. Sometimes downloads fail, but thats probably due to the filesize. But with a bit of patience it works well.
Great! Have to stay in app to download though. It is good!
A good and handy source of knowledge
Good for reading while in areas without a connection.

When I download big files I often get a error that says "Request not successful" which stops the download. Makes bigger files impossible to download. I also have to keep my phone on and unlocked or else it won't keep downloading. I tried to download it off the website but the app doesn't recognize the file when I open it through the app. Pretty good when you have things downloaded. Would be 5 stars

why default to library tab but not reader tab? need more click when just want to search something from a fixed zim file. Sometimes this will crush the app when try to switch tab before the scanning takes a break. the current way of handling bookmarks and history is totally unacceptable.bookmarks and history should at least be stored and independent from data file.

The app (and of course the available offline files) are excellent, and makes knowledge readily accessible. The main shortcoming is that files must be downloaded completely whenever new information are added. So when 50mb worth data is added, this addition is not available as a separate download (as continuation or splits) that will be synced along with the previous data, instead the entire 3.4GB must be downloaded again. Its too exploitative.

Downloads bigger than 4 GB are disabled. Hence no Wikipedia. So for me, this app is useless. Other tools split files internally, if they are bigger than 2 GB. Never saw a SD Card on android supported by Kiwix. My 512 GB SD Card was just formatted by Android and is mounted as SdCardFs. And internal memory is usually now big enough. Sorry, but you should improve your app to the needs of the people. Thanks.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The problem with slow filesystem detection has a fix in an upcoming release, for now I am afraid the solution is to wait on the screen 1min, maybe more. Long click on a grey list item to see the status. SdCardFs is not an actual filesystem but a virtual one and adds extra difficulty into detecting the true format

With exFAT formatted SD card, options to download >4GB files are greyed out (workaround is to download to internal memory or offline on PC and then move to microsd)

Large archives are gone from the download list. You need to get them with a browser & torrent client then insert the files into Kiwix's storage area. (Yes, the microSD is exFAT - I manually added the 78GB Wikipedia) Once you get the content, it's an incredibly handy tool.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: We don't save big files on FAT32 SD cards anymore. You need a SD card formatted in exFAT to support big files and then you will then be again able to download big content. Or you configure internal storage in the settings.

This was a 1 star review until I tried keeping the app on internal storage and selecting external storage within the app settings. Before, when I moved the entire app to external via my phone settings, everything went pear shaped. -1 star for the hours of headache and several uninstall/reinstalls
I do enjoy the app, it is a great app. Excellent
Not working. Uninstalled it. Edit: back to work after the update
google_play_reviews.replyContent: nice !

google_play_reviews.content: after installation asking get content further not working make me frustrated any solution?? not working .

i have never used it. it asked me to rate it the first time i opened it. i have no zim files installed yet. i rate this a 1 star in protest to being bothered to rate something i clearly haven't used. it might actually be a 5 star app. i have no way of knowing yet.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Fair enough, sorry about this Scott. Hope you'll enjoy the app anyway :-)

google_play_reviews.content: A fantastic and wonderful piece of software. Carry our best approximation to the sum of all human knowledge in your pocket!
Downloaded simple english wikipedia 1.6 Gb zim file not opening. Help needed.
It is very difficult to download the data. It crashes frequently
google_play_reviews.replyContent: We have released a few new versions since your feedback which are far more stable. Would be great if you could tell us if it works better now.

google_play_reviews.content: I really love it. It enables me read almost, everything medical offline . Thanks to wikipedia
Very useful, amazing search option, plenty of information at fingertips, offline.
An encyclopedia is always with you when you need it!
Very good for offline use of Wikipedia and other downloadable wiki content.

google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback and your rating. We provide a client for Linux which runs on Debian. You can then download the Wiktionary content. Next year a new version of Kiwix for Linux will be published and we will ask to package it.

google_play_reviews.content: Very useful. Intuitive interface. Excellent Work on a free app.
Great app and thanks for developing such a helpful app
cant say how much helpful it is. no internet but yes wikipedia. thanks a lot. i have been using this for almost 1 and half year
servers are so slow...You can hardly download any of the contents.

google_play_reviews.replyContent: We have released a few new versions since your feedback which are far more stable. Would be great if you could tell us if it works better now.

google_play_reviews.content: Allows me to read Wikipedia offline on a plane
I cant to search by arabic names
All downloads work well. Would be a 5 if the contents links worked on wiki source, articles, etc offline and the search more than alphabetic.

where's the control to load the page I want?
very impressive app meant for offline reading.

Android download manager needs a resume ability. Multi-gigabyte download, gets 90% done. Different app forces a reboot because it had a problem. Kiwix download picks up where it left off? Noooooooo. Starts over from 0. Implement a resuming protocol please. Like MFTP, T.127, BitTorrent, or UFTP. Heck, even HTTP can resume. I can't even use this app till the data finishes downloading. #NoStars
it's fantastic but doesn't work with formulas in night mode

I cant describe how much I hate what this app has put me through the past 5 years, struggling to get files to open, or download, or recognize its own content, picking a simple damn dir on sd (/kiwix)nooooope. Files and indexes randomly depriciate. KIWIX IS A NIGHTMARE, and there's no where else to go offline.
Best offline wiki reader I've used. Very usefull for offline wikipedea use.
i will give five star when u add more buttons and built-inapp shortcuts
A very useful solution for offline logophiles. Pity, though, it doesn't include wikisaurus.
The idea is great but the app itself introduced very bad experience.

Latex images won't load properly in many articles. Sometimes they load sometimes they don't, but most of the times, they don't load all. Sometimes sections won't expand. Using October Wikipedia physics and math.

it was good but now it is terrible. Download is always stuck in background and there is no way to speed up. And it is keeping pop-up some old download notification even it has been cancel long time ago. Now the main Page is stuck some page and there is no way to back to home. The home icon is not working at all. And language filter is not working at all!
its agreat app ,but we still deserve more languages.

super app that is offline Google ....... only download you want subject that u desire and open offline.

Excellent for all those who do not enjoy internet access everyday but do not want to sacrifice research for any topic. Thanks to my phone's internal storage I chose the ZIM files including all the photos, although they consume about 100GB. But that is plenty potential knowledge in my pocket!
Love having wikipedia offline for when I am away from WiFi for extended periods of time. This app works great and has many more packages to download besides just wikipedia. (even videos)
i am good with reading the book
Very nice app for researching. I like it.

I would very much appreciate the option to download specific portals and categories. Or download images with those specified collections and just do text on other categories. Otherwise a wonderful app.
